tasks.title: Project Setup and Initial Structure
tasks.description: Initialize a new Rust project, create the necessary directory structure, and add the 'clap' dependency to Cargo.toml.
tasks.notes:
Rust project initialized successfully.
src/ directory created.
Cargo.toml configured with project name and 'clap' dependency.
Initial placeholder files (main.rs, cli.rs, calculator.rs, error.rs) created.

tasks.title: Implement CLI Argument Parsing with 'clap'
tasks.description: Define the main 'calc' command, subcommands (add, subtract, multiply, divide), and flags (--help, --version) using the 'clap' crate in `src/cli.rs`. Set up basic parsing in `src/main.rs` to display parsed arguments.
tasks.notes:
'calc' command is defined.
'add', 'subtract', 'multiply', 'divide' subcommands are defined.
'--help' and '--version' flags are recognized.
Basic argument parsing successfully extracts operation and numbers.
Handles default 'clap' error messages for unrecognized commands (will be replaced by custom error later).

tasks.title: Implement Custom Error Handling
tasks.description: Define an `AppError` enum in `src/error.rs` to cover invalid input, division by zero, insufficient arguments, and unknown commands. Implement `std::error::Error` and `std::fmt::Display` traits for `AppError` to provide user-friendly messages.
tasks.notes:
`AppError` enum with variants like `InvalidInput`, `DivisionByZero`, `InsufficientArguments`, `UnknownCommand` is defined.
Each error variant provides a specific, user-friendly message when formatted.
`AppError` can be used as the return type for operations.

tasks.title: Implement Calculator Logic - Addition
tasks.description: Implement the `add` function in `src/calculator.rs` that takes a slice of numbers, sums them, and returns the result. Integrate this function into `src/main.rs` to be called by the 'add' subcommand. Include logic to parse string inputs to numbers, returning `AppError::InvalidInput` on failure.
tasks.notes:
`add` function correctly sums a list of numbers.
System outputs the sum for 'calc add <number1> <number2> ...'.
Invalid numeric inputs for 'add' display 'Invalid input. Please provide numbers only.' error.
Appropriate return types (e.g., `Result<f64, AppError>`) are used.

tasks.title: Implement Calculator Logic - Subtraction
tasks.description: Implement the `subtract` function in `src/calculator.rs` that takes a slice of numbers, subtracting subsequent numbers from the first. Integrate this function into `src/main.rs` for the 'subtract' subcommand. Handle invalid numeric inputs.
tasks.notes:
`subtract` function correctly calculates the difference.
System outputs the result for 'calc subtract <number1> <number2> ...'.
Invalid numeric inputs for 'subtract' display 'Invalid input. Please provide numbers only.' error.

tasks.title: Implement Calculator Logic - Multiplication
tasks.description: Implement the `multiply` function in `src/calculator.rs` that takes a slice of numbers and returns their product. Integrate this function into `src/main.rs` for the 'multiply' subcommand. Handle invalid numeric inputs.
tasks.notes:
`multiply` function correctly calculates the product.
System outputs the product for 'calc multiply <number1> <number2> ...'.
Invalid numeric inputs for 'multiply' display 'Invalid input. Please provide numbers only.' error.

tasks.title: Implement Calculator Logic - Division
tasks.description: Implement the `divide` function in `src/calculator.rs` that performs division of two numbers, returning `AppError::DivisionByZero` if the divisor is zero. Integrate into `src/main.rs` for the 'divide' subcommand. Handle invalid numeric inputs.
tasks.notes:
`divide` function correctly calculates the quotient.
System outputs the quotient for 'calc divide <dividend> <divisor>'.
Inputting a divisor of zero displays 'Error: Cannot divide by zero.'.
Invalid numeric inputs for 'divide' display 'Invalid input. Please provide numbers only.' error.

tasks.title: Refine Help and Version Display
tasks.description: Configure 'clap' to display a comprehensive help message for `calc --help` and the application version for `calc --version`. Ensure the help message lists all supported operations and their syntax.
tasks.notes:
`calc --help` displays a comprehensive help message with all commands and syntax.
`calc --version` displays the current application version.

tasks.title: Implement Insufficient Arguments Validation
tasks.description: Enhance `src/cli.rs` using 'clap's argument validation features to ensure each subcommand receives the minimum required number of arguments. If insufficient arguments are provided, output 'Insufficient arguments for command '<command>'. Use 'calc --help' for usage.'.
tasks.notes:
Entering an operation with too few arguments (e.g., 'calc add 5') displays the specified insufficient arguments error message.
Appropriate minimum argument counts are enforced for each operation.

tasks.title: Implement Unknown Command Handling
tasks.description: Configure 'clap' and `src/main.rs` to catch unknown commands (e.g., 'calc unknown 5 3') and display the custom error message: 'Unknown command. Use 'calc --help' for usage information.'.
tasks.notes: Entering an unknown command displays the specified unknown command error message.

tasks.title: Unit Tests for Calculator Logic
tasks.description: Write comprehensive unit tests for the functions in `src/calculator.rs`, covering normal operations, edge cases (e.g., negative numbers, large numbers), and error conditions (e.g., division by zero).
tasks.notes:
All functions in `src/calculator.rs` have associated unit tests.
Tests cover valid inputs and expected outputs.
Tests cover invalid inputs (e.g., non-numeric) and expected error outputs (e.g., `AppError::InvalidInput`).
Tests cover specific edge cases like division by zero.
`cargo test` runs successfully with all calculator logic tests passing.

tasks.title: Integration Tests for CLI Commands
tasks.description: Write integration tests that simulate full CLI interactions, verifying correct output for all supported operations, help/version flags, and all specified error conditions (invalid input, division by zero, insufficient arguments, unknown command).
tasks.notes:
Integration tests cover all user stories and their acceptance criteria.
Tests simulate calling the `calc` executable with various arguments.
Output for valid commands is verified.
Correct error messages are displayed for all invalid scenarios.
`cargo test` runs successfully with all integration tests passing.
